content: In #6960, we are removing equiv.set.range to keep the equivalent and already existing equiv.of_injective. As a follow up, should it be renamed, or have aliases like function.injective.equiv_range, or function.left_inverse.equiv_range? How about the more powerful function.left_inverse.{ring,alg}_equiv_range?

I think it makes more sense as equiv.of_injective, ring_equiv.of_injective, ..., since they are more liable to change when the definition of ring_equiv changes, than when function.injective or set.range changes. And hopefully we can figure out a general theory of equiv_like maps, so that we don't need to redo the construction for each foo_equiv.
